alert.note: Alert for Perry (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 05 at 12:03PM EDT until August 05 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Perry County in southeastern Ohio... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 1203 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain moving across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen from earlier storms. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Somerset, Thornville and Glenford. This includes the following streams and drainages... Little Rush Creek, Painter Run, Jonathan Creek, Somerset Creek, and Muddy Run. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
